column5: Nice to have a day off and celebrate Canada Day the way it should be celebrated, outside and fishing  Headed out from Oakville and as we are just about to leave harbour to go onto the big lake we hear someone yell "PAUL" from shore, it was Peter (Biteme)!  Motored over and had a nice chat with him.  Offered to take him out but he said he had "chores" LOL.  Fishing was pretty slow, but I managed a nice 28 incher.      She had a nasty hitchhiker, who didn't live to see another day          Then Paul got a little shaker.      Peter warned us that there were lots of shakers and that most of the time it was hard to tell they were even on.  We fished for a few more hours with nothing and then Paul reeled in all the lines and sure as Pete said, one had a shaker on.  Don't even know how long it was on for.    Anyhow, Fish - meet my BBQ        Happy Canada Day everyone!!  Joey
As Paul would say, Nice Fish
yeah that is a great way to spend Canada day
Right on Joey and Paul   Can't get any better than that Good on you for taking care of the hitchhiker Enjoy your BBQ!!! Leechman
nice fish joey congrats to you and paul

Nice photos (as always) Joey Not sure how we've managed not to bump into each other been so close today Oh well...must be because we were a bit busy figuring out how to get to the boat some of the serious fish we've got today  ha ha ha Next time  Cheers, Ice Fisherman
Hey  Joey   If your going out anytime, email me and I will give you an overview of how the water is setup. That is my job since I run the water plant.    Darren
WTG Joey and Paul! Weather looks pretty calm too. Clean looking fish...who gets to eat the lamprey?
Nice job.  I will be going out of Bronte the next couple of evenings.  I am pretty stoked as we have not fished for Salmon this year yet.

It was nice seeing you guys almost made up for missing lakair this year  glad to see you ggot some fish dont be shy come down and fish more often.  Paul I have to tell you I was so close to covering your truck in bum fodder you have no idea!!  OH YEAH THANKS FOR THE OFFER MAYBE ANOTHER TIME  Peter
Hahahahaha, LMAO, I'd pay well to see pictures of that!  Glad to see you got a few fish, I may try my luck out there this evening.
Nice fish. I fished out of Whitby for a few hours, went from 60ft to 140ft never marked a thing   gonna try on the weekend again.
Nice shot of the adipose clip, only one with it's fin intact?
So ya finally made it out.  Well - did Paul roll you out of bed at 5:00am ... or was he a gentleman and let you sleep until 6:00am.
Nice one Joey & a great way to spend a day off !!
Yep, only the one still intact CLofchik!    5:30 Rich
